summary: Sam Halpern is a person mentioned in several CIA documents. He was interviewed in 1987 and 1998 regarding Congressional investigations, the impact of the Vietnam War, changes in CIA recruits, tensions within the agency, the IG report on the Bay of Pigs, and its relevance to Operation Mongoose. He discussed differences in governmental structure and CIA involvement between the two operations, and recounted his experiences with personnel selection and coordination with the DDI. He is also mentioned in a memo detailing a CIA operation to conduct audio surveillance on Manuel Artime, and in documents related to the E. Howard Hunt investigation.
